taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For J. A. N. de Nesle, eighteenth-century French gardener at Poitiers]

bio:treatment.discussion: Some authors recognize two species in Neslia, while others recognize only N. paniculata with two subspecies somewhat separated geographically, though intermediates are common in areas of overlap (P. W. Ball 1961). The sole difference between them is whether the fruit apex is truncate (subsp. paniculata) or apiculate [subsp. thracica (Velenovský) Bornmüller or N. apiculata Fischer, C. A. Meyer & Avé-Lallemant].

references.reference: Ball, P. W. 1961. The taxonomic status of Neslia paniculata (L.) Desv. and N. apiculata Fisch., Mey. & Avé-Lall. Feddes Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. 64: 11–13.
